title: U.S. Christmas lights energy costs
summary: This bar chart has 3 columns on the x axis representing Lighting Type, and Energy cost in U.S. dollars in each Lighting Type on the y axis.

Lighting Type Standard incandescent lights (125 lights 4 watts each) has the highest Energy cost in U.S. dollars and LED lights (280 lights 0.04 watts each) has the lowest Energy cost in U.S. dollars.
The difference of Energy cost in U.S. dollars between the highest and lowest Lighting Type is 27.15.
min_summary: This is a bar chart representing Lighting Type in the x axis and Energy cost in U.S. dollars in the y axis.

Lighting Type Standard incandescent lights (125 lights 4 watts each) has the highest Energy cost in U.S. dollars and LED lights (280 lights 0.04 watts each) has the lowest Energy cost in U.S. dollars.

max_summary: This bar chart has 3 columns on the x axis representing Lighting Type, and Energy cost in U.S. dollars in each Lighting Type on the y axis.

The Energy cost in U.S. dollars is appeared to be the highest at Lighting Type Standard incandescent lights (125 lights 4 watts each) and lowest at Lighting Type LED lights (280 lights 0.04 watts each).
The difference of Energy cost in U.S. dollars between the highest and lowest Lighting Type is 27.15.
The highest value 27.21 at Standard incandescent lights (125 lights 4 watts each) is almost 2.42 times larger than the average value 11.27.

data.Lighting Type: Standard incandescent lights (125 lights 4 watts each)
